title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 52.10 - Personal application for renewal or increase of license
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 52.10 - Personal application for renewal or increase of license

State Regulations

Application for renewal or increase of grade of license shall
be made by each pilot in person before the commissioners at a meeting of the
board held not more than 30 days prior to the expiration of the license of such
pilot. Any pilot applying for an increase of grade of license shall be required
to submit a list of the names of the vessels piloted during the year, stating
the dates and nature of service rendered, such as pilotage inbound, outbound, or transport, and the drafts of the vessels. Any pilot applying for renewal of
license shall be required to submit a memorandum indicating the number of
vessels piloted during the year by categories--inbound, outbound or transport. The memorandum shall also indicate, by dates, periods of more than five days
when pilots do not work while on vacation, sick leave, or for other reasons. In
addition, the pilot may be required to pass an examination prescribed by the
board. Notes

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
